p: In Eq (6), p 1 and p 2 are the scale parameters controlling the effects of local temperature and rainfall respectively. The two terms p 3 and p 4, are time-driven baseline effects characterizing trends in m that switch on depending on the time period τ 1. The parameter τ 1 could be viewed as the timing of baseline change in the mosquito population, due to the possible interference between ZIKV and CHIKV for instance, and/or local mosquito control measures. The function 1(⋅) is an indicator function, which equals 1, if the condition in the brackets is true; but is 0 otherwise.
